comments.author: mweinberger@ortsbild-aschau.de
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.16 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/10.0.648.133 Safari/534.16
Build Identifier: Firefox 4 RC

With firefox 4 RC1 the browser based web client of one.com does not show the scrollbar on the right side of the Inbox, as well as of all other in sub folder sorted mails. In previous Firefox versions this worked fine. This issue makes the browser unusable for this mail application of one.com.

Reproducible: Always
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.16 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/10.0.648.133 Safari/534.16
Build Identifier: Firefox 4 RC

With firefox 4 RC1 the browser based web client of one.com does not show the scrollbar on the right side of the Inbox, as well as of all other in sub folder sorted mails. In previous Firefox versions this worked fine. This issue makes the browser unusable for this mail application of one.com.

Reproducible: Always

comments.author: bebe@mozilla.ro
comments.text: Could you provide a testcase for this issue.
comments.raw_text: Could you provide a testcase for this issue.
comments.creator: bebe@mozilla.ro

comments.author: mweinberger@ortsbild-aschau.de
comments.creator: mweinberger@ortsbild-aschau.de
comments.text: Unfortunately I don't know how to provide a test case. It is a dynamic mail tool, with frames, so providing the html-code will not work. Don't know on which framework it is base on. To get a first idea I attached a screenshot. Can I add a debugger to Firefox to check for some error?
comments.raw_text: Unfortunately I don't know how to provide a test case. It is a dynamic mail tool, with frames, so providing the html-code will not work. Don't know on which framework it is base on. To get a first idea I attached a screenshot. Can I add a debugger to Firefox to check for some error?

comments.author: bebe@mozilla.ro
comments.creator: bebe@mozilla.ro
comments.raw_text:
Did you encountered this problem on other public sites?
(I don't have access to one.com accounts and there is no free trail version available)
Please verify this issue with a clean profile and safe mode maybe there is a addon or a setting that is causing this problem.

 http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Managing%20profiles
 http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe%20Mode

I did an additional test and installed firefox RC on my linux box. I did the test as new user with the same result :-(. I can create a temporary mail account for you at one.com, but I don't want to distribute the account information through this bug-report.
